top_comments.comment: As a pianist who rarely listens to classical music, I definitely needed some good pieces to flex on my audience.

I’ve been ADDICTED to classical guitar recently. One of the best instruments IMO. Some of the notes that get used a lot in classical pieces pop with the sound. And the tremolo mixed in with a base melody is soo good. In some pieces it sounds like modern rock and I throw my head up and down to the beat. It’s just too good!

comments_since_last_sample.body: I just found a piece called "Liebeslied" by Kreisler (arranged by Rachmaninoff) and I friggin love it. I think it's my new favorite song. I really like how Tiffany Poon played it too
I love this kind of episode, it makes me discover such beautiful pieces! And I thought of this, Billie Eilish did a song called Goldwing and it would be cool if you guys did a reaction
Thank you for for bringing up Nikolai Kapustin. His compositions for piano are energetic, often jazzy... unjustly rather unknown!
english cathedral choral music is definitely something to look into if you like the parry, other composers include Stanford, Howells, Bairstow, Vaughan Williams,
I like your funny videos, but i think i like really better how you both are in love with music
I love Debussy, sometimes all I can think about is Debussy❤️❤️

I'm going to scream because I can't find Le Sapin on Spotify, and it sounds beautiful too TT--TT
Is it known by any other names? I genuinely can't seem to find it, if anyone could help me I'd be really grateful
As a pianist who rarely listens to classical music, I definitely needed some good pieces to flex on my audience.
As a Finn, I'm just happy to see a piece by Sibelius on the list.
There was this website where you get your notes, somthing like sl*, can you tell me the name of the website?
I'm a bit sad that the harpist played the ending asbjust plain glissandos instead of playing what was written :'(

My suggestions for pieces for classical nerds: Villa-Lobos’ String Quartets, Pärt’s Cantus, Röntgen’s Violin Concerto, Schnittke’s first Concerto Grosso, Martinu’s second Violin Concerto and Rhapsody-Concerto, Paderewski’s Violin Sonata, Poulenc’s second Piano Concerto, Arutunian’s Trumpet Concerto, and anything by Rautavaara.

I’ve been ADDICTED to classical guitar recently. One of the best instruments IMO. Some of the notes that get used a lot in classical pieces pop with the sound. And the tremolo mixed in with a base melody is soo good. In some pieces it sounds like modern rock and I throw my head up and down to the beat. It’s just too good!

"Last one from US"? You sure it wasn't all yours, Eddy? It seemed like it, lol. 
So happy vocal music was represented. Love acapella choirs.
Do MORE videos like this, please.
every choral piece (non-orchestral) is underrated. not like Carmina Burana Orff or Verdi Messa da Requiem. good to know that twoset also put choral piece YEY

1:02 lmaooo 😂 it’s not bad ! But the word « dance » is actually pronounced with the sound « anh » like the onomatopoeia when you’re hurt. It’s shorter than the usual « an » en English 
[dãs] here’s the phonetic word 😊
pls make more of these kinds of pieces😩😩😩 i rlly enjoy listening to the pieces very much :)
